div.p:
—Amidst the plains of North America, some
powerful nation, which has disappeared, constructed circular, square, and
octagonal, fortifications; walls, 6,000 toises in length; tumuli, from 700 to
800 feet in diameter, aud 140 feet in height, sometimes round, sometimes
with several stories, and containing thousands of skeletons. These skeletons
are the remains of men less slender and more squat than the present in-
habitants of those countries. On a vast space of ground at the Lower
Orinoco, as well as on the banks of the Casiquiare, and between the sources
of the Essequibo and the Rio Branco, there are rocks of granite covered
with symbolic figures. These sculptures are the extinct remains which evi-
dently belonged to nations different from those which now inhabit the same
regions.—Humboldt’s Travels.
